semantic_title: Supervision of High-Risk Pregnancy Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > b. Selection of OB Principal or First-listed Diagnosis > 2) Supervision of High-Risk Pregnancy

content.full_text: Codes from category O09, Supervision of high-risk pregnancy, are intended for use only during the prenatal period. For complications during the labor or delivery episode as a result of a high-risk pregnancy, assign the applicable complication codes from Chapter 15. If there are no complications during the labor or delivery episode, assign code O80, Encounter for full-term uncomplicated delivery. For routine prenatal outpatient visits for patients with high-risk pregnancies, a code from category O09, Supervision of high-risk pregnancy, should be used as the first-listed diagnosis. Secondary chapter 15 codes may be used in conjunction with these codes if appropriate. (Evidence: pg no: 65, L54-L60)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding supervision of high-risk pregnancies during prenatal period and delivery (Evidence: pg no: 65, L54-L60)
key_concepts: O09 category for prenatal period only (Evidence: pg no: 65, L55-L56)
Labor and delivery coding differences (Evidence: pg no: 65, L56-L57)
Secondary code usage (Evidence: pg no: 65, L59-L60)

detailed_rules.rule_text: O09 codes only for prenatal period (Evidence: pg no: 65, L55-L56)
detailed_rules.explanation: Supervision of high-risk pregnancy codes are restricted to prenatal visits, not labor and delivery (Evidence: pg no: 65, L55-L56)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use complication codes during labor/delivery for high-risk pregnancies (Evidence: pg no: 65, L56-L57)
detailed_rules.explanation: During labor and delivery, use specific complication codes from Chapter 15, not O09 codes (Evidence: pg no: 65, L56-L57)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use O80 for uncomplicated delivery in high-risk pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 65, L57-L58)
detailed_rules.explanation: If no complications occur during labor/delivery despite high-risk pregnancy, use O80 (Evidence: pg no: 65, L57-L58)

detailed_rules.rule_text: O09 as first-listed for high-risk prenatal visits (Evidence: pg no: 65, L58-L59)
detailed_rules.explanation: For routine prenatal visits in high-risk pregnancies, O09 should be the first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 65, L58-L59)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Secondary Chapter 15 codes may be used with O09 (Evidence: pg no: 65, L59-L60)
detailed_rules.explanation: Unlike Z34 codes, O09 codes can be used with additional Chapter 15 codes when appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 65, L59-L60)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if encounter is prenatal or labor/delivery
Step 2: For prenatal visits, use O09 as first-listed diagnosis
Step 3: Add secondary Chapter 15 codes if specific complications present
Step 4: For labor/delivery, use specific complication codes or O80 if uncomplicated

code_ranges.description: Supervision of high-risk pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 65, L55)
usage_rules: First-listed diagnosis for high-risk prenatal visits (Evidence: pg no: 65, L58-L59)
Can be used with secondary Chapter 15 codes (Evidence: pg no: 65, L59-L60)

code_ranges.description: Chapter 15 complication codes (Evidence: pg no: 65, L56-L57)
usage_rules: Use instead of O09 during labor/delivery (Evidence: pg no: 65, L56-L57)
Can be secondary codes with O09 during prenatal period (Evidence: pg no: 65, L59-L60)

specific_codes.description: Encounter for full-term uncomplicated delivery (Evidence: pg no: 65, L57-L58)
specific_codes.context: Use for uncomplicated delivery in high-risk pregnancy

references_to.title: Routine outpatient prenatal visits
references_to.explanation: Contrasts with normal pregnancy supervision coding

coding_scenarios.scenario: 32-week prenatal visit for patient with gestational diabetes
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 32-week prenatal visit, patient with gestational diabetes, blood sugars well controlled
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify as prenatal visit for high-risk pregnancy
Step 2: Use O09.893 as first-listed diagnosis (supervision of high-risk pregnancy, third trimester)
Step 3: Add O24.410 as secondary code for gestational diabetes

correct_coding.rationale: High-risk prenatal visit uses O09 first with secondary Chapter 15 codes (Evidence: pg no: 65, L58-L60)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should include O09 code for high-risk pregnancy supervision
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Omitting supervision code for high-risk pregnancy

coding_scenarios.scenario: Delivery of patient with history of preeclampsia, no complications during delivery
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Full-term delivery, patient with history of preeclampsia in previous pregnancy, no complications during current delivery
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify as delivery encounter, not prenatal visit
Step 2: Determine no complications occurred during delivery
Step 3: Assign O80 for uncomplicated delivery

correct_coding.rationale: Uncomplicated delivery uses O80 even in high-risk pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 65, L57-L58)

incorrect_coding.rationale: O09 codes not used during labor and delivery
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using O09 codes during delivery encounters

warnings: Do not use O09 codes during labor and delivery (Evidence: pg no: 65, L55-L56)
best_practices: Use O09 as first-listed for high-risk prenatal visits (Evidence: pg no: 65, L58-L59)
Add secondary Chapter 15 codes when specific complications present (Evidence: pg no: 65, L59-L60)
common_mistakes: Using O09 codes during labor and delivery (Evidence: pg no: 65, L55-L56)
Not using O09 for high-risk prenatal supervision
tips: Distinguish between prenatal visits and labor/delivery encounters
O09 codes can be combined with other Chapter 15 codes unlike Z34
implementation_notes: Different coding approach for prenatal vs. delivery encounters
